Package: org.grails.datastore.mapping.dynamodb

[Java] Class DynamoDBDatastore

      • org.grails.datastore.mapping.dynamodb.DynamoDBDatastore
      • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
        org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.grails.datastore.mapping.model.MappingContext$Listener

        public class DynamoDBDatastore
extends org.grails.datastore.mapping.core.AbstractDatastore

        A Datastore implementation for the AWS DynamoDB document store.

        Authors:
        Roman Stepanenko based on Graeme Rocher code for MongoDb and Redis
        Since:
        0.1

            Analyzes associations and for those associations that need to be stored in a dedicated AWS table, creates info object with details for that association.

            If the specified association has a dedicated AWS table, returns info for that association, otherwise returns null.

            Returns id generator for the specified entity.
            java.lang.String getTableNamePrefix()
            If specified, returns table name prefix so that same AWS account can be used for more than one environment (DEV/TEST/PROD etc).

            Constructs a DynamoDBDatastore using the given MappingContext and connection details map.

            Parameters:
            mappingContext - The DynamoDBMappingContext
            connectionDetails - The connection details containing the ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY settings

          • public java.lang.String getTableNamePrefix()

            If specified, returns table name prefix so that same AWS account can be used for more than one environment (DEV/TEST/PROD etc).

            Returns:
            null if name was not specified in the configuration
